results.title: Exploring the ocean. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Discusses the ocean floor, plants, animals and the food chain, the ocean’s storehouse of minerals and how they are deposited by the water cycle, and pollution in the ocean.

results.title: What is music
results.creator_credit: Peter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Presents the great range of sounds we call music, beginning and ending with a stream and its accidental sounds, Includes music from percussion and blues to ancient Chinese and Aboriginal music along with classical Renaissance and contemporary electronic pieces.

results.title: The Hideout
results.brief_description: Portrays two children who face a dilemma when timber belonging to a neighbour is used by another child in building their hideout. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: Talkback: a study in communication
results.creator_credit: Anthony Pelissier, Ian Latimer and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: This film presents a dramatised case study of communication within a factory. It shows a cross section of managers, and demonstrates how each has a particular responsibility for ensuring that communication at work is effective communication.

results.title: Open classroom
results.brief_description: This film explores some of the issues involved in the organisation of the open classroom, and focuses on ordinary non-purpose built schools in both Britain and USA. It emphasises the need for an underlying structure and a high level of involvement and co-ordination by teachers and other personnel. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Ya Vamos. No. 1. A Mexico
results.creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Joshua Tree Productions
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film. Provides some cultural background of Mexico to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “entender y hablar”. Shows Lucia Sznchez and Sara Lopez travelling throughout Mexico.

results.title: Using equivalent fractions to compute sums
results.brief_description: Fraction County, so named because of the Fraction surnames given to each family, found it had families that could not live together happily. The problem was solved when the families realized they had something in common: equivalent fractions get along together. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: Fraction County, so named because of the Fraction surnames given to each family, found it had families that could not live together happily.
